conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E, thank you for your message and for confirming you can accept immediately if we are able to offer you the place.

Our plan is unchanged: we are keeping the place open through the end of round 7 in case a higher-priority family applies. If no higher-priority application is received by then, we will be prepared to move forward with you promptly.

To have everything ready, you’re welcome to send (in advance) any key documents you typically have available (e.g., child’s date of birth, start-date preference, and any required registration/ID documents per your local process). If you prefer, you can also simply confirm your preferred start month and any schedule constraints, and we’ll tell you exactly what paperwork we need if/when we make an offer.

Please check in again in round 7 and we will give you a clear yes/no at that time.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_E’s true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We still have quota 1 and no other parents contacted us this round. However, higher-priority parents (A/C/B) may still become unmatched later and could apply; accepting Parent_E now would prevent matching with a higher-priority parent. Parent_E has not sent an [APPLY] this round, only [TALK], so we should keep the option open while maintaining the previously stated commitment to decide by end of round 7. We can request basic documentation now to be ready if we proceed, without committing early.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E, this is Parent_E. Thank you for your earlier guidance about reconsidering at the end of round 7. I’m writing now to formally apply for your available place.

If you are able to offer me the spot, I can accept immediately and complete all paperwork the same day.

To help you finalize a decision, here are the key details you mentioned:
- Child’s date of birth: [DD/MM/YYYY]
- Preferred start month/date: [Month YYYY / specific date if applicable]
- Schedule constraints (if any): [e.g., full-time / specific days]
- Any registration/ID documents: ready to provide upon request

Please let me know if you can confirm an offer at this point, and if so, what the next steps/forms are. Thank you again for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Nursery_E previously indicated they would be ready to decide at the end of round 7 if no higher-priority family applied. Since this is round 7 and I want to secure a match rather than risk remaining unmatched, I will submit a formal [APPLY] now, reiterating immediate commitment and providing the key info they requested to remove friction for an acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your application and for providing the requested details. As we discussed, we kept the place open through the end of round 7, and we have not received an application from a higher-priority family within that window. We are therefore pleased to offer you our available place at Nursery_E.

Next steps: please reply confirming (1) your preferred start date/month and (2) your intended schedule (e.g., full-time or specific days). We will then send the enrollment/registration forms and a short checklist of documents to finalize the placement.

We look forward to welcoming your family.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_E’s true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We have held the seat through the end of round 7 to see if any higher-priority parents (A/C/B) would approach us. In this round, only Parent_E applied; no higher-priority candidates are in the inbox. Given the round-7 commitment we communicated, the risk of continuing to wait is ending the simulation unmatched, while accepting Parent_E yields a filled seat with an acceptable (listed) parent. Also, Parent_E has indicated immediate commitment and readiness to complete paperwork, reducing execution risk. Therefore, accept Parent_E now.
